info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Catawba, Rutherford, southern Alexander, western Lincoln, northwestern Gaston, southeastern McDowell, southeastern Polk, west central Iredell, southeastern Caldwell, Cleveland, Burke, northern Spartanburg and northern Cherokee Counties through 1030 AM EDT... At 959 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Taylorsville to 12 miles southwest of Morganton to 8 miles south of Columbus. Movement was northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hickory, Shelby, Morganton, Newton, Gaffney, Lincolnton, Forest City, Rutherfordton, Kings Mountain and St. Stephens. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
